node.title: Jeongyeong can't wait to tell his daughter 'I'm your father' when they meet after border closures
node.alt: A mother and daughter lie down smiling at each other.
node.description: Border changes mean visa holders will be able to finally reunite with loved ones in Australia from December 1.
node.content:
["Jeongyeong Lee can hardly contain his joy.", "The Tasmanian-based chef will be able to meet his 15-month-old daughter for the very first time next month, after changes to Australia's border rules were announced on Monday.", "\"When I heard [the news], I thought\u00a0'Oh my God, finally I can see my family' \u2026 That is the best thing for me this year,\" he said.", "He is already imagining what it will be like to hold his child in his arms for the first time.", "\"Of course I want to kiss my wife as well.\"", "", "
The young couple are counting down the days until they can reunite in Tasmania.
", "From December 1, fully vaccinated eligible visa holders and international students will be welcomed back to Australia without needing to apply for a travel exemption, although Tasmania's borders will not be open until December 15.", "Previously, only Australian citizens and permanent residents have been able to return without an exemption.", "Mr Lee's wife, Sunhee Han, a temporary visa holder, has been stuck in South Korea since she returned there while pregnant in March 2020.", "She gave birth to their first child \u2013 a daughter named Nagyeol \u2013 in August 2020, but the couple never imagined pandemic border closures would keep them apart for so long.", "", "
Mr Lee's baby was born in South Korea in August 2020, but he hasn't been able to hold her.(Supplied)
", "\"I'm extremely happy ... Although I had to raise my daughter without Jeongyeong, I didn't want to think negatively or complain of this COVID situation which I can't control,\" Ms Han said.", "\"But now thanks to the re-opening border rules, we will get together for this Christmas. I can't wait to see and hug him.\"", "Mr Lee said while he and his wife were excited to be reunited and hoped she could return in mid-December, they have not yet booked a ticket as he is looking for a\u00a0suitable house for his young family.", "
Wife in India to reunite with husband in Australia
", "", "
Sunil and Pragati Patidar were married in September 2018, and have been kept apart for more than two years.(Supplied)
", "For Pragati Patidar, who has been stranded in India throughout the pandemic and separated from her husband in Australia for two years, the news came as \"a ray of hope\".", "\"It was really a devastating situation for us,\" Ms Patidar told the ABC.", "\"No-one has imagined that COVID has destroyed everything \u2026\u00a0COVID has changed our lives.\"", "Her husband Sunil, an engineer\u00a0in Melbourne, called her on Monday to tell her the good news and to book her a ticket to Australia.", "\"I told her, 'Pack your bags, we are meeting soon',\"\u00a0Mr Patidar said.\u00a0", "At first, she couldn't believe it.", "\"I'm really, really excited. All the anxiety, depression, whatever I have faced \u2014\u00a0it's now going to vanish,\" she said.", "Upon her arrival in Australia in two weeks' time, the couple plan to attend a temple for some Hindu rituals and blessings, before exploring Sydney and embarking on a road trip down to Melbourne \u2014 their first trip since their marriage in September 2018.", "", "
The couple can't wait to reunite and explore Australia together.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "\"The first thing I will do is give him a tight hug,\" she said, adding her family in India were overjoyed that she could now be reunited with her husband.\u00a0", "She is on a student visa, undertaking a Masters of Analytics at RMIT in Melbourne, and is looking forward to face-to-face classes in 2022 after studying for a year remotely.", "Mr Patidar, who has lived in Melbourne since 2016, said it had been a \"heartbreaking\" two years apart\u00a0\u2014 he lost loved ones to COVID-19 and was trying to \"be strong\" as his wife's 22 applications for a\u00a0travel exemption were repeatedly knocked back.", "\"I told myself and my wife that everything will be fine soon. Have faith in God. Keep patience,\" he said.", "He said there were times where he lost hope, but now the couple are on\u00a0\"cloud nine\" at the prospect of being reunited soon.", "The Patidars\u00a0said while they\u00a0and many others have struggled with the separation, they are\u00a0grateful to the Australian government for opening the border to visa holders.", "", "
Muhammad Ilham Rizky and Andara Harryman are expecting their first child in January.(Supplied)
", "Another couple celebrating recent changes to Australia's border policies are Andara\u00a0Harryman and Muhammad Ilham Rizky, who are expecting their first child in January.", "In October, the government decided to classify the parents of Australian citizens and permanent residents as immediate family \u2014\u00a0something Ms Harryman described as her \"greatest wish\".", "The change means the Indonesian-born Australian can bring her mother to Melbourne, and on Friday her mother's visa exemption was granted, after previously being rejected.", "\"I'm very happy and it's a hope that became a reality,\" she said.", "", "
Andara (centre) hopes to show her\u00a0mother Ranny (right) a bit of Australia when she arrives.(Supplied\u00a0)
", "Mr Rizky said his mother-in-law's visit would mean a lot to his family.", "\"I'm so happy, it's a support system for us, so I can still work without worrying my wife will be all alone at home with the baby,\" he said.", "
Temporary visa holders call for extensions as visas expire
", "Paramjot Singh is a spokesperson for the 485 Visa Lives Matter group, which has been campaigning for the government to freeze or extend the visas of people stranded overseas.", "", "
Mr Singh says many visa holders are crushed that their visas have expired while they were stuck overseas.(Supplied)
", "He said while some of the 485 temporary graduate visa holders were pleased to be allowed to return on December 1, many of the nearly 14,000 people\u00a0still stuck outside Australia have had their visas expire.", "\"Priority should be extending the visas before opening the borders,\" he said.", "Mr Singh, who studied mechanical engineering at Edith Cowan University in Perth, has already booked his ticket back to Australia and will arrive just days before his own visa is set to expire on December 4.", "\"We are just requesting for the government to extend our visas,\" he said.", "A spokesperson for the Department of Home Affairs told the ABC the government \"is aware that a number of Temporary Graduate Visa holders are offshore and are unable to return to Australia as their visas have expired\".", "\"Active consideration is being given as to what might be done to assist this cohort,\" they said in a statement.", "\"These decisions will be made by government in the context of broader COVID-19 response efforts and Australia's workforce needs.\"", "Last week, Immigration Minister Alex Hawke assured 485 visa holders that concessions\u00a0would be announced soon.", "Monday's announcement also included refugees and those on working holiday visas, as well as tourists from Japan and South Korea.", "The government says it expects some 200,000 temporary visa holders to arrive in Australia, and is looking\u00a0to increase the number of visa places for skilled migrants and refugees under the humanitarian program, which are currently capped at 79,600 and 13,750 respectively.", "Paul Power, the chief executive of the Refugee Council of Australia, welcomed the announcement that fully vaccinated refugees and humanitarian visa holders would be able to enter Australia from December 1.", "He said it would be \"life-changing\" for more than 9,500 refugees who already have humanitarian visas but have been barred from entering the country due to COVID travel restrictions.\u00a0", "\"This news will be particularly welcome for the many families in Australia with relatives who have been\u00a0waiting for up to two years in host countries badly hit by economic crises worsened by the COVID pandemic,\"\u00a0Mr Power said.", "\"Urgent attention must be given by the Department of Home Affairs to ensuring that refugees holding Australian humanitarian visas have access to vaccinations in their current host countries, particularly where vaccination rates are low due to unrest or insufficient resources.\""]
